speaker: Fry
text: [voice-over] Space. It seems to go on and on forever. But then you get to the end and the gorilla starts throwing barrels at you.

speaker: Fry
text: And that's how you play the game!

speaker: Boy
text: You stink, loser!

speaker: Panucci
text: Hey, Fry. Pizza goin' out! C'mon!!

speaker: Fry
text: Michelle, baby! Where you going?

speaker: Michelle
text: It's not working out, Fry. [Next to her is a guy with his arm around her. The cab pulls away.] [shouting; from cab] I put your stuff out on the sidewalk!

speaker: Fry
text: I hate my life, I hate my life, I hate my life.

speaker: Bike Thief
text: Happy new year!

speaker: Fry
text: Hello? Pizza delivery for, uh ... [He reads the delivery note.] ... Icy Wiener? Aw, crud! I always thought at this point in my life I'd be the one making the crank calls! [He sits down on the chair, puts his feet on the desk and opens a can of beer.] Here's to another lousy millennium.

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Ten!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Neuf!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Otto!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Saba!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Eksi!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Wu!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Char!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Thathu!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Nee!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] One!

speaker: Fry
text: What the--?

speaker: Fry
text: My God! It's the future. My parents, my co-workers, my girlfriend; I'll never see any of them again. Yahoo!

speaker: Terry
text: [melodramatically] Welcome to the world of tomorrow!

speaker: Lou
text: Why do you always have to say it that way?

speaker: Terry
text: Haven't you ever heard of a little thing called showmanship? [He turns to Fry.] [dramatically] Come, your destiny awaits!

speaker: Lou
text: Have a nice future.

speaker: Fry
text: Cool! Just like in Star Trek! [The door closes on his head.] Ow!

speaker: Leela
text: Good afternoon, sir. [Fry is impressed with what he sees. Leela turns around. She has one huge eye in the middle of her face. Fry screams.] Name?

speaker: Fry
text: Uh, Fry.

speaker: Leela
text: I'm Leela. Now, it's New Year's Eve so I'd like to decide your fate quickly and get out of here.

speaker: Fry
text: Can I ask you a question?

speaker: Leela
text: As long as it's not about my eye.

speaker: Fry
text: Uh...

speaker: Leela
text: Is it about my eye?

speaker: Fry
text: Sort of.

speaker: Leela
text: Just ask the question.

speaker: Fry
text: What's with the eye?

speaker: Leela
text: I'm an alien, alright? Now let's drop the subject.

speaker: Fry
text: Cool, an alien! Has your race taken over the Earth?

speaker: Leela
text: No, I just work here.

speaker: Fry
text: Wait a minute! Is that blimp accurate?

speaker: Leela
text: Yep. It's December 31st, 2999.

speaker: Fry
text: My God! A million years!

speaker: Leela
text: I'm sure this must be very upsetting for you.

speaker: Fry
text: Y'know, I guess it should be but, actually, I'm glad. I had nothing to live for in my old life. I was broke, I had a humiliating job and I was beginning to suspect my girlfriend might be cheating on me.

speaker: Leela
text: Well, at least here you'll be treated with dignity. Now strip naked and get on the probulator.

speaker: Leela
text: Interesting. Your DNA test shows one living relative. He's your great-great-great-great-great-great-great...

speaker: Leela
text: ...great-great-great-great-great nephew.

speaker: Fry
text: That's great! What's the little guy's name?

speaker: Leela
text: Professor Hubert Farnsworth.

speaker: Fry
text: Eurgh!

speaker: Fry
text: Y'know, I'm the luckiest guy in the whole future. I've been given a second chance and this time I'm not going to be a total loser. [A buzzer buzzes.] What's that?

speaker: Leela
text: Your permanent career assignment.

speaker: Fry
text: Delivery boy? No! Not again! Please! Anything else!

speaker: Leela
text: Take your hands off me! You've been assigned the job you're best at just like everyone else.

speaker: Fry
text: What if I refuse?

speaker: Leela
text: Then you'll be fired--

speaker: Fry
text: Fine!

speaker: Leela
text: Out of a cannon into the Sun!

speaker: Fry
text: But I don't like being a delivery boy.

speaker: Leela
text: Well that's tough! Lots of people don't like their jobs but we do them anyway. [She points at a poster of a man wearing a hardhat with the caption "You Gotta Do What You Gotta Do".] You gotta do what you gotta do. Now hold out your hand. I'm gonna implant your career chip. It'll permanently label you as a delivery boy.

speaker: Fry
text: Keep that thing away from me!

speaker: Leela
text: Hold still, dammit. I don't have good depth perception! [She jumps at Fry, misses, and falls into a cryogenic freezer. It sets itself for 1000 years.] You've got until the count of five to let me out of here. One--

speaker: Fry
text: See you in a thousand years! [He starts to walk out but hesitates. He walks back and changes the freeze time to five minutes.] You owe me one.

speaker: Fry
text: Whoa!

speaker: Man #1
text: Radio City Mutant Hall.

speaker: Fry
text: Cool! [He steps into the tube.] Um. Cross Town Express?

speaker: Man #2
text: Pft! Tourist!

speaker: Fry
text: Hey! A phone booth! I can call my nephew. [An impatient robot joins the queue behind him. It is more or less human-shaped, grey, with an antenna on top of its head.] Wow! A real live robot! Or is that some kind of cheesy New Year's costume?

speaker: Bender
text: Bite my shiny metal ass.

speaker: Fry
text: It doesn't look so shiny to me.

speaker: Bender
text: Shinier than yours, meatbag!

speaker: Bender
text: Listen, buddy, I'm in a hurry here. Let's try for a two-fer!

speaker: Booth Voice
text: Please select mode of death: "Quick and Painless" or "Slow and Horrible".

speaker: Fry
text: Yeah, I'd like to place a collect call.

speaker: Booth Voice
text: You have selected: "Slow and Horrible".

speaker: Bender
text: Great choice! [Knives, tasers and Jacob's Ladders come out from behind a hatch.] Bring it on, baby!

speaker: Bender
text: C'mon, c'mon! Kill me already! By the way, my name's Bender!

speaker: Fry
text: Help! What's happening?

speaker: Booth Voice
text: You are now dead. Thank you for using Stop-N-Drop, America's favourite suicide booth since 2008.

speaker: Bender
text: Lousy, stinking rip-off! [He kicks the booth.] Well, I didn't have anything else planned for today. Let's go get drunk!

speaker: Leela
text: Two, three-- Hey!

speaker: Terry
text: [melodramatically] Welcome to the world of tomorrow!

speaker: Leela
text: Shut up, Terry.

speaker: Ipgee
text: This is unacceptable, Leela. You must find this Mr. Fry and install his chip.

speaker: Leela
text: Look, he's just a nobody who doesn't want to be a delivery boy. I'd really rather not force it on him.

speaker: Ipgee
text: Well that's your job, whether you like it or not. And it's my job to make you do your job whether I like it or not, which I do, very much! Now get to work! [Leela leaves. He puts his feet up on the desk.] Life is good!

speaker: Fry
text: Why would a robot need to drink?

speaker: Bender
text: I don't need to drink, I can quit anytime I want! [He belches fire.] So they made you a delivery boy, huh? Man, that's as bad as my job.

speaker: Fry
text: Really? What do you do, Bender?

speaker: Bender
text: I'm a bender. I bend girders, that's all I'm programmed to do.

speaker: Fry
text: You any good at it?

speaker: Bender
text: You kidding? I was a star! I could bend a girder to any angle: 30 degrees, 32 degrees, you name it! [unsure] 31. [normal] But I couldn't go on living once I found out what the girders were for.

speaker: Fry
text: What?

speaker: Bender
text: Suicide booths! [He finishes his drink and swallows the bottle.] Well, Fry, it was a pleasure meeting you. I'm gonna go kill myself.

speaker: Fry
text: Wait! You're the only friend I have!

speaker: Bender
text: You really want a robot for a friend?

speaker: Fry
text: Yeah, ever since I was six.

speaker: Bender
text: Well, OK. But I don't want people thinking we're robo-sexuals. So, if anyone asks, you're my debugger.

speaker: Fry
text: Oh, no, it's the Cyclops! [He crouches down behind Bender.] Don't look! Don't look!

speaker: Bender
text: I'm not looking!

speaker: Leela
text: This is officer 1B-DI requesting back-up.

speaker: Smitty
text: We'll be there in five minutes.

speaker: Bender
text: We can hide in here. It's free on Tuesdays!

speaker: Nimoy
text: Welcome to the Head Museum. I'm Leonard Nimoy.

speaker: Fry
text: Spock? Hey! Hey... Do the thing!

speaker: Nimoy
text: I don't do that anymore.

speaker: Fry
text: This is unbelievable! What do you heads do all day?

speaker: Nimoy
text: We share our wisdom with those who seek it. It's a life of quiet dignity.

speaker: Woman
text: Feeding time!

speaker: Leela
text: Hmm. [She looks around and sees Fry and Bender hiding behind a shelf in amongst other assorted heads.] I'm sorry, Fry, but I have to install your career chip.

speaker: Fry
text: Yeah, well, if you're sorry why are you doing it?

speaker: Leela
text: It's my job. You gotta do what you gotta do! [Fry backs away and hits a shelf with the heads of US presidents on it.] Watch it!

speaker: Nixon
text: That's it! You just made my list!

speaker: Fry
text: Ow! Stop it! Down, boy! Bad president!

speaker: Smitty
text: Alright, buddy, step away from the head!

speaker: URL
text: I'm gonna get 24th century on his ass!

speaker: Leela
text: Please, officers, there's no need to use force.

speaker: URL
text: Let us handle this, weird-y.

speaker: Leela
text: Oh, come on, he's just a poor kid from the Stupid Ages.

speaker: Smitty
text: Keep your big nose out of this, eyeball!

speaker: Leela
text: No-one makes fun of my nose.

speaker: URL
text: Damn!

speaker: Leela
text: You guys were totally out of control.

speaker: Smitty
text: It's our job. We're peace officers.

speaker: URL
text: Yeah, you know the law: You gotta do what you gotta do.

speaker: Bender
text: Oh, we're trapped!

speaker: Fry
text: Wait a second. You're a bender, right? We can get out of here if you just bend the bars.

speaker: Bender
text: Dream on, skin tube. I'm only programmed to bend for constructive purposes. What do I look like, a de-bender?

speaker: Fry
text: Who cares what you're programmed for. If someone programmed you to jump off a bridge would you do it?

speaker: Bender
text: I'll have to check my program ... yep.

speaker: Leela
text: [from outside] Open up!

speaker: Fry
text: C'mon, Bender! It's up to you to make your own decisions in life. That's what separates people and robots from animals ... and animal robots.

speaker: Bender
text: You're full of crap, Fry! [He turns and a dangling wire catches on his antenna and electrocutes him.] You make a persuasive argument, Fry.

speaker: Fry
text: Come on, Bender! You can do it.

speaker: Bender
text: Can't ... I ... can't ... do ... it!

speaker: Fry
text: Yes!

speaker: Bender
text: You were right, Fry! From now on I'm going to bend what I want, when I want, who I want! I'm unstoppable!

speaker: Fry
text: I don't know how you did that.

speaker: Leela
text: Wait!

speaker: Bender
text: [shouting] No, thanks.

speaker: Bender
text: Looks like one of us will have to bend this grate.

speaker: Fry
text: Good Lord! What is this?

speaker: Bender
text: It's the decaying ruins of Old New York. Welcome home, pal!

speaker: Fry
text: It's my old neighbourhood. Man, this brings back a lot of memories.

speaker: Bender
text: Keep 'em to yourself, Pops!

speaker: Fry
text: This is where I brought my girlfriend on our very first date.

speaker: Fry
text: My God! She's gone. Everyone I ever knew or cared about is gone.

speaker: Bender
text: Wait! There's someone you know!

speaker: Fry
text: Oh, can't you leave me alone? I'm miserable enough already.

speaker: Leela
text: Look, I know it's not much consolation but I understand how you feel.

speaker: Fry
text: No, you don't. I've got no home, no family--

speaker: Bender
text: No friends.

speaker: Fry
text: My whole world is gone. You can't possibly understand what it feels like to be so alone.

speaker: Leela
text: I understand. I'm the only one-eyed alien on this whole planet. My parents abandoned me here as a baby and I don't even know what galaxy they were from. I know how it feels to be alone.

speaker: Fry
text: Look, Leela, I don't understand this world but you obviously do, so I give up. If you really think I should be a delivery boy, I'll do it. [He holds out his hand to Leela. She gets the implant gun ready. Fry cringes and looks away. The gun clicks but Fry feels nothing. He opens his eyes and sees Leela drop her own chip on the floor.] Your chip. What are you doing?

speaker: Leela
text: Quitting.

speaker: Fry
text: Why?

speaker: Leela
text: Because I've always wanted to. I just never realised it before I met you.

speaker: Fry
text: What is the matter with you?

speaker: Bender
text: I just wanted to be part of the moment.

speaker: Leela
text: Hey! He stole my ring!

speaker: Bender
text: Sorry. [He hands Leela's ring back.] Well, that solves the mystery of the missing ring. This calls for a drink.

speaker: Leela
text: I don't wanna spoil the party but we're all job deserters now. We're unemployed and we have nowhere to go.

speaker: Fry
text: Correction: We're unemployed but we have a doddering old relative to mooch off of.

speaker: Clark
text: [on TV] Hello, I'm Dick Clark's head. Welcome to a special year 3000 edition of New Year's Rockin' Eve!

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Who are you?

speaker: Fry
text: I'm your dear old Uncle Fry.

speaker: Farnsworth
text: I don't have an Uncle Fry.

speaker: Bender
text: You do now!

speaker: Farnsworth
text: By God, I am your nephew! This is absolutely incredible!

speaker: Bender
text: Can we have some money?

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Oh, my, no.

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Let me show you around. That's my lab table and this is my work-stool. And over there is my intergalactic spaceship! [He points in the general direction of a big green spaceship in a huge hangar next to the lab.] And here's where I keep assorted lengths of wire.

speaker: Fry
text: Whoa! A real live spaceship!

speaker: Farnsworth
text: I designed it myself. Let me show you some of the different lengths of wire I used.

speaker: Smitty
text: [from outside] Attention, job deserters! Come out with your hands up. We have you partially surrounded.

speaker: Fry
text: No!

speaker: Nixon
text: Get those bums!

speaker: Bender
text: Well, we're boned!

speaker: Leela
text: Can't we get away in the ship?

speaker: Farnsworth
text: I suppose it is technically possible. Though I am already in my pyjamas.

speaker: Fry
text: I'll get us out of here.

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Can anyone drive stick?

speaker: Leela
text: I can. As long as I don't have to parallel park.

speaker: URL
text: If they try to take off, give 'em an ass-ful of laser.

speaker: Leela
text: Prepare for lift-off. Ten.

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Nine!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Amania!

speaker: Crowd
text: [chanting] Seven!

speaker: Aliens
text: [chanting; in alien] Six.

speaker: Terry
text: [dramatically] Five!

speaker: Nimoy
text: Four.

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Three.

speaker: Bender
text: Two.

speaker: Leela
text: One!

speaker: Fry
text: Blast-off!

speaker: Nixon
text: Fire! Fire!

speaker: Smitty
text: I can't see nothing. Pretty though!

speaker: Fry
text: So, I guess, without jobs, we'll be fugitives forever.

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Not necessarily. Are you three, by any chance, interested in becoming my new spaceship crew?

speaker: Bender
text: New crew? W-What happened to the old crew?

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Of those poor sons of-- But that's not important. The important thing is I need a new crew. Anyone interested?

speaker: Fry
text: Yes! Yes! That's exactly the job I've always wanted!

speaker: Leela
text: Thanks for the offer, Professor, but we don't have the proper career chips.

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Oh, that won't be a problem. As luck would have it, I saved the chips from my previous crew.

speaker: Fry
text: This is awesome! Are we gonna fly through space fighting monsters and teaching alien women to lurve?

speaker: Farnsworth
text: If by that you mean "transporting cargo" then yes. It's a little home business I started to fund my research.

speaker: Fry
text: Cool! What's my job gonna be?

speaker: Farnsworth
text: You will be responsible for ensuring that the cargo reaches its destination.

speaker: Fry
text: So, I'm gonna be a delivery boy?

speaker: Farnsworth
text: Exactly!

speaker: Fry
text: Alright! I'm a delivery boy!
